intro: Astrophytum pseudogracillimum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed star cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is a low-growing, spineless cactus with a distinctive star-shaped crown composed of fleshy, ribbed segments. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are typically short-lived but highly attractive to pollinators. Its compact size and unique appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Astrophytum pseudogracillimum is well adapted to dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems.
